questions: I am long, you move me around with your lips and tongue, I get wet with saliva and I get sucked. What am I?
Set me to vibrate when you want some alone time. What am I?
I once let over 1000 different people inside me, until I was ripped open by something long and hard. What am I?
I absolutely love holding your buns all day. What am I?
I drip when you take me in the mouth. What am I?
Every man has me. I'm a word that begins with the letter "P" and for me to grow, I need stimulation. What am I?
You use your hand to whack me off, the bigger I am, the louder I make people scream. What am I?
When I go in, I can cause some pain. I'll fill your holes when you ask me to. I also ask that you spit and not swallow. What am I?
I'm spread out before being eaten. Your tongue gets me off. Sometimes people lick my nuts. What am I?
I produce moisture and oxygen into the air.When it gets cold, I change colors.When it freezes, I fall down, even if it's not slippery.What am I?

I make ash, but I'm not a bonfire.I can expel rocks, but I'm not a slingshot.I can be a mountain, but I'm not in the Himalayas.I have a crater, but I'm not the Moon.I erupt, but I don't have a bad temper.What am I?
If fruit comes from a fruit tree, where does chicken come from?
Bright pearls were scattered on a black cloth.What are they?
We're very large though we seem small,We float on high and never fall,We shine like jewels in the night,But in the day concealed from sight.What are we?
I saw a restless shepherd travelingBack and forth on his path.He garbs himself in that which goesIn the same and in an opposite direction.He goes hither and thither among creatures.What is it?
Two little golden horns sitting on a cloud, They float slowly in the sky,And look very proud.What is it?
Hick-a-more, Hack-a-more, On the kitchen floor;All the horses, all the men,Couldn't driveHick-a-more, Hack-a-more,Off the kitchen floor.
What falls on the water but never gets wet?
What has no hands, no feet, no head, and no body, but can open any door?
When rain falls, does it ever get up again?
White sheep on a blue hill.When the winds stop, they stand still.They walk far away when the winds blow.What are they?
I gently patter on the roof at night. I mutter quietly and lull you to sleep, asking, "All sleeping? All right!"What am I?
What man cannot live inside the house?
An old woman sweeps behind the house, but the dust turns up at your doorstep.What is it?
Riddle me, riddle me, rin-ะต-go, mother gave me some seeds to sow. The seeds were black, the ground was white. If you riddle me that, you'll escape my bite.What are they?

It is energy and motion, it can fly across the ocean.It can listen and even speak, it can see and even seek.It eats neither fruit nor gruel, it eats energy and fuel.Better say: It doesn't eat; It is transformed into heat.What is it?
The shape of my form will waver and bendBy the things I'm destroying and those I will rend.My color changes from bright red to blue,The power I'm using will dictate my hue.What am I?
A house full, a hole full, but you can never gather a bowl full.What is it?
I'm so weak that a little wind can move me.I'm so strong that when you cut me with a knife, it leaves no track.What is it?
What is it that anyone can divide, but no one can see where it is divided?
As I was going o'er London Bridge, I heard something crack. Not a man in all England can mend that!What is it?
My step is slow, and I breathe snow.To the ground, I bring death.My marching brings an end to me,I'm slain by the sun or engulfed by the sea.What am I?
I am all that you see, yet I'm nothing at all, and from you, I will flee.Formed of deception, I will twist your perception.Wherever I'm rising, I warp the horizon.What am I?
If you like being in nature and want to camp overnight, you can sleep in one of these.What is it?
There is a common plantThat's like something in the sky.It is bright yellow,And grows to be 10 feet high.What is it?
I bloom in yellow-golden,With fluffy little chicks.From the cold, I turn barren.What am I?
Colorful flowersBloomed in the garden,Beautiful colorsBut autumn is coming.What flowers are they?
A house with two residents - sometimes one, seldom three.Crack the walls, eat the dwellers, then throw it away.What is it?
I have lots of bark but no bite. What am I?

I am a plant you use in food, and my name consists of 5 letters.Remove the first letter of my name, and you'll get a form of energy.Get rid of two, and you'll get something necessary for life.Scramble together the last 3 letters, and you can drink it.What am I?
I am a small seed, and there are three letters in my name.Take away two letters, and I still sound the same.What am I?
The moon is my mother, The sea is my dad.I have a million brothers.When I reach land, I'm dead.What am I?
There's a bridge in a hollowAnd a hundred cross itNo mason, no blacksmith, nor carpenter built it.What is it?
You will find me in the mountains, and you'll find me in a creek.I have no mouth, but I speak every tongue.I have no ears, yet I answer every cry, and I always have the final word.What am I?
We are the pearls of night stolen in the light of day.What are we?
I can run but never walk,Have a mouth but never talk,Have a head but never weep,Have a bed but never sleep.What am I?
Walks in the wind but stands where there's moist,Counts time, stops clocks,Swallows kingdoms, gnaws rocks.What is it?
What is thick but thin as a puff,What is short but tall as a bluff,What brings peace and calms the sea,What dazzles the eyes of you and me?
I'm gentle enough to soothe your skin,Light enough to fly through the sky,Strong enough to crack rocks.What am I?
I can fly but have no wings,I can cry but have no eyes,Wherever I go, darkness follows me.What am I?
I come in a box and melt in your hands, I'm a Valentine's day gift that's widely loved.What Am I?
It could be delivered by mail, email, by hand, or even by pigeon.It is sometimes short, sometimes lengthy, and with deep, profound, or simple feelings.What is it?
Current, serious, steady, or fast, It can also be either painful or beautiful,And sometimes it can forever last.What is it?
Lipsticks come in this colorAnd some ladybugs as well.And on Valentine's DayThis color roses many shops sell.What color is it?

I have wings, but I'm no bird.I have a bow and arrow, but I'm not Robin Hood.I'm a Roman god, but I'm not Jupiter.I look like a toddler, but I need no diaper.My image expresses love, but I'm not a heart.Who am I?
Balloons and cards, and bearsUse this red shape to sayThat I love you so muchEvery Valentine's Day.What is it?

I come in many shades: red, pink, yellow, orange, or white; but I'm not a crayon.I'm fragrant, but I'm not perfume.People put me in water, but I'm not dirty laundry.I have a stem, but I'm not a wine glass.People gift me on Valentine's day, but I'm not a stuffed animal.What am I?
I'm tiny but quite expensive. But when you use me, all I do is hang and sparkle.What Valentine's Day gift am I?
Who marries many times but always remains single?
You'll see two of me at every wedding, but I am not a person.What am I?
I connect two people, but I touch only one.What am I?
I have no finish line in sight, but you can break me. Once you have me, you are bound for life.What am I?
I am another word for love, and I consist of nine letters. I rhyme with selection and perfection.What am I?
I can make you happy, I can make you cry. I can make you want me, but I can also drive people to madness.What am I?
When I'm lost, I hurt the most, as well as when not had at all. I'm often hard to express and easy to ignore. You can give me to just one person, or to many. What am I?
I can be clogged, and I can break. I can be given but also kept. I can be crushed or be made whole. What am I?
From that which comes within itself,It builds its table on my shelf.What is it?
I wiggle and I cannot see,Sometimes I'm underground, and at times on a tree.I really don't want to end up on a hook,I turn into a person when combined with a book.What am I?
I have legs but rarely walk.I bite many but never talk.I search for places that can hide me,Because those that feed me also hate me.What am I?
I have around 5,000 feathers and I'm a bird native to America. People say Benjamin Franklin wanted me to be the national bird of the United States.What am I?
I always sleep with my shoes on.What am I?
I stash treasures in the ground,And dig them out in winter.You can find me in a tree,Nibbling on my nutty dinner.What am I?
What goes tick-tock, bow-wow, tick-tock, bow-wow?
I have a duck's bill, a beaver's tail, webbed feet, and I lay eggs.What am I?
I have no arms and legs. I crawl on my belly, and I have a lethal sting. When I go to sleep, I curl into a ring but I leave my eyes open wide. What am I?
I live on a farm and I'm pink.I'm famous for saying "oink...oink."Come near me, and you'll realize I stink.What am I?
My arms are longer than my legs, and I can be taught sign language to communicate with humans.What am I?
I grow down as I grow up.What am I?
answers: A goose - goose feathers are called down.

questions: I am always black and whiteBut I'm not an old TVI'm a kind of animalThat begins with the letter ZWho am I?
What king do you make if you take the head of a llama, the middle of a pig, the back of a buffalo, and the tail of a stallion?
Sneaky as a shadow in the dead of night,Cunning but affectionate if given a bite.Never owned but often loved.What am I?
I'm grey, but I'm no wolf,I have long ears, but I'm not a rabbit,I have hooves, but I'm not a cow.What am I?
I'm a pet with cute ears, four legs, and a tail at the end.You surely heard me barking. I'm known as man's best friend.What am I?
Some are afraid of this creature,Because it has a large bite.So be careful out in the ocean,One of its kin is a Great White.What is it?
Throughout the day I rest and sleep.At night, I fly and hunt.I have no feathers on my wings,Nor do I chirp or grunt.What am I?
I am named after the animal I eat.What am I?
I may be small, but I can climb a tower.What am I?
I'm not a superhero, but I have a cape. I have a comb, but I don't use it on my hair, and I am famously territorial.What am I?
This is a type of animalKnown for its long face.It's very good at runningSo people ride it in a race.
What lives in a tiny house all alone?
answers: A baby chick in an egg.

questions: My first letter is in sea but not in ocean,The second is in change but not in motion.My third letter in boat but never in ship,And the fourth is in travel as well as in trip.The fifth letter is in dark but not in caves,And my whole is a triangle popping up from the waves.  What am I?
My first letter is in cloud, but never in sky.The second is in roll but not in lie,My third letter is in water but not in trees.My whole makes you milk, kefir, and cheese.What am I?

My first letter is in follow but not in lead, and the second is in write but not in read.My third letter is in sky but not in cloud, my fourth is in humble but not in proud.My all makes circles in a bowl, or lies on a plate cooked up whole.What am I?
I sizzle like bacon, but I hatched from an egg,I expand when I eat, and I have no legs.What am I?
I have got a crown like a king, but I'm a disgrace when I sing.There are fewer eyes on my face than my tail, but only when I'm a male.What am I?
I'm the opposite of a dog, but I'm not a god.I move my tail when I'm mad and growl when I'm pleased.What am I?
I feed on leaves from treetops but my feet never leave the earth.What am I?
I go to school all my life, and I never leave the water, even though I breathe air. What am I?
I often join you at parties and holidays, but I never get to enjoy them.What am I?
I grow from egg to fish to creature.I burp when I talk and I jump when as I walk.What am I?
I have no legs, eyes, or nose, but if you give me enough time, I can move the earth.What am I?
I have black circles around my eyes - even when I'm not exhausted.What am I?
Play me with a ball and bat. Or hear me sing in a tophat.What am I?
Alive without breath, as cold as death.All in mail never clinking.Never thirsty, ever drinking.What am I?
Born in water, I drown in water.A blood-thirsty beast you can barely see.What am I?
As small as your thumb, I am light in the air.You may hear me before you see me, But trust me, I'm there.What am I?
I have a face like a tree and skin like the sea.A great beast I am, yet small vermin frighten me.What am I?
I create my lair with earthen string,And dispatch my prey with a biting sting.What am I?
I had no father, only a grandfather... I shall bear no sons, only daughters.What am I?
I plow and plow but never sow.What am I?
I have four legs but no tail. Usually, I am heard only at night.What am I?
What is that which, while it lives, constantly changes its habit, That is buried before it is dead, and whose tomb is valued wherever it is found?

My first letter is in window but not in pane.My second's in road but not in lane.My third is in oval but not in round.My fourth is in hearing but not in sound.My whole is known as a sign of peace.And from Noah's Ark, I won quick release.What am I?
A prickly house a little host contains.The pointed weapons keep back from pains,So he, unarmed, safe in his fort remains.Who is he?
What can honk without a horn?
I am an insect, and the first part of my name is another insect.What insect am I?
My first letter is in ocean but never in sea.My second's in wasp but never in bee.My third is in glider and also in flight.My whole is a creature that comes out at night.What am I?

Oh, how I love my dancing feet!They stay together - oh so neat.And when I want to walk a line,They all stay together and do double time.I count them up, ten times or more,And race on-off, across the floor.
I can jump, I can swim,I swing from tree to tree.And I can also weave a houseThat's much bigger than me.What am I?
It can be in a hat,Or out of the bag.If you see it you'll be smitten,'Cause it's fluffy like a mitten.What is it?
It's small but larger than a bee,And agile as a flea.It hums but does not buzz,And it's not covered with fuzz.It is a small collectorOr juicy flower nectar,What is it?
It can be white, blue, or black,Humped or have a horn.And when it talks, it sings its minuets,As it's traveling the depths.What is it?
I have no sword, I have no spear,Yet rule a horde that many fear,My soldiers fight with a wicked sting,I rule with might, yet I'm no king.What am I?
The cow is my cousin.If you see my name, you'll understand why.What am I?
What has armor but is not a knight,Snaps but is not a twig,And is always at homeEven on the move?
If a man could carry my burden, he would break his back.I am not rich, but leave silver in my track.What am I?
I hang upside-down on trees.I'm the opposite of busy bees.I sleep and sleep, I'm very slow, and on each footI have three toes.What am I?
I am both a bird and a kind of fruit, and I can even be a person.What am I?
You say "hey." I'll eat it.I say "neigh."What am I?
My start goes on toast, and my end's how birds move.My baby eats leaves, whereas I drink flowers.
Cupid without a bow.Donner with no kebab.One who dances, one who prances, all dragging present-giving dad.What am I?
I've got a hole in my back and legs I lack.I live where I can't breathe and I eat without teeth.What am I?
When I walk, I jump, and when I stand, I sit.What animal am I?
I peel like an onion yet remain whole.Which mystery creature am I?
I walk on silken strings and catch all sorts of things.When you find my home, I am gone.What am I?
I'm the only known mammal incapable of jumping. That's because I'm very large.What animal am I?
My field of vision is 270 degrees, and I'm quiet and sneaky like a ninja when I hunt for my prey.What bird am I?
I was born small and pink, but then I grew big and black and white.I'm lazy to cook, so all I eat is bamboo.What animal am I?
I've got horns, but I can't honk.Instead, I bleat, but I'm no sheep.What am I?
I hover and zip through the air with a dazzling flare.I move from flower to flower, humming a tune, but I'm no insect.What am I?
I am a king, and the jungle is my kingdom.I have a lush mane, and I'm tough to train.What am I?
I live in a den, and I wear a furry suit.I like to eat fish, but also berries and fruit.I love honey more than you do.What animal am I?
I wear a tuxedo when I'm swimming, and I slide on my tummy across the ice.What am I?
I have a mane, but I'm no lion. I wear shoes, but I'm not a human.What am I?
I have a lump or two on my back, and I live in the sand.I'm tough and I'll carry you over the land.What am I?
I'm spotty and swift, but I'm no leopard.And no one wants to play cards with me.What am I?
It takes me a couple of weeks to digest what I eat, and I'm never in a hurry.What am I?
You may find me cute, but I'm too big for a pet.I have a long trunk, and I never forget.What am I?

I have four of these, With matching extremities. They can do many things, And hardly ever bring me pain. Unless I stick them with a pin, Or burn them sometimes when... What is it that I can wiggle at will? And use in other means still?

I am not found on any ground,But always in the air;Though charged each cloud with thunder loud,You can not find me there.Now, if from France you choose to danceYour way just into Spain,I there am seen, and near the queen,In hail, in mist, and rain.What am I?

My head and tail both equal are, My middle slender as a bee. Whether I stand on head or heel Is quite the same to you or me. But if my head should be cut off, The matter's true, though passing strange Directly I to nothing change. What Am I?

With potent, flowery words speak I, Of something common, vulgar, dry; I weave webs of pedantic prose, In effort to befuddle those, Who think I while time away, In lofty things, above all-day The common kind that lingers where Monadic beings live and fare; Practical I may not be, But life, it seems, is full of me! What am I?
Hold the tail, While I fish for you. What am I?
My first is a part of the day, My last a conductor of light, My whole to take measure of time, Is useful by day and by night. What am I?

I know what my job is, The point has been made. You say I have a big head, And you're right, I'm afraid. Put me in my place, And then leave me alone. What I need most, Is someone to drive me home. What am I?

In camps about the centre I appear; In smiling meadows seen throughout the year; The silent angler views me in the streams, And all must trace me in their morning dreams, First in the mob conspicuous I stand, Proud of the lead, and ever in command. What am I?
A dagger thrust at my own heart,Dictates the way I'm swayed.Left I stand, and right I yield,To the twisting of the blade.What am I?
I can flutter and take your breath away. I can take a beating, but do not bruise. If I stopped you would be sure to lose. Everyday I am with you. What am I?

I am a word of five letters. Take away my first and I am the name of what adorns the estate of many of the nobility of England. Take away my first and second, and I am the name of a place where all the world was once congregated. Take away my last, and I am the name of a beautiful mineral. Take away my two last, and I am the name of a fashionable place of resort. I am small in stature but capable of doing a great deal of mischief, as I once did in London in the year 1666. What word am I?

I'm as plain to see as black & white. I prefer to roam about at night. Just don't attack or startle me. Or odiferous emissions may result you see. I'm an omnivore yes it's true. But what's my name tell me do?
I can be all colors of the rainbow, Or have no color at all. Sometimes I'm empty, Sometimes I'm full. What am I?
Dark with white markings, And smooth like a rock. Where learning occurs, I help convey thought. What am I?
My teeth are sharp, my back is straight, to cut things up it is my fate. What am I?
answers: tricky riddle, hard riddle, logic riddle, what is it, word riddle

questions: My tongue is long, my breath is strong, And yet I breed no strife; My voice you hear both far and near, And yet I have no life. What am I?
Without a bridle, or a saddle, across a thing I ride a-straddle. And those I ride, by help of me, though almost blind, are made to see. What am I?
Duels of good and evil, A fighter of good am I, Revealed beside watched words, King of the black night sky. What am I?
Poke your fingers in my eyes and I will open wide my jaws. Linen cloth, quills, or paper, my greedy lust devours them all. What am I?
You throw me away, I find my way back; Traditionally I'm wooden, With an arch in my back. What am I?
Often held but never touched, always wet but never rusts, often bites but seldom bit, to use me well you must have wit. What am I?
I am the only thing that always tells the truth. I show off everything that I see. I come in all shapes and sizes. So tell me what I must be! What am I?
answers: I must be a mirror, of course.

questions: When I am filled I can point the way, When I am empty nothing moves me, I have two skins, one without and one within. What am I?
You go in me for brushing, For flushing, For rushing; But please go in me one at a time, Or someone might be blushing. What am I?
Late afternoons I often bathe. I'll soak in water piping hot. My essence goes through my see through clothes. Used up am I; I've gone to pot. What am I?
I can slash but I have no knife, I can dash but I have no legs, I can pound but I have no hammer, I can star but I have no stage. What am I?
I say everything I hear to others around. I'm not an animal, nor part of the human race. I will, immediately, repeat after you; But only if my tail is in place. What am I?
I have two arms, but fingers none. I have two feet, but cannot run. I carry well, but I have found I carry best with my feet OFF the ground. What am I?
We capture light, and yet we don't. We reflect rays of sun, and yet we don't. Without us all the world is gray and dull for everyone. What are we?
I move without wings, between silken strings, I leave as you find, my substance behind. What am I?
Almost everyone sees me without noticing me, For what is beyond is what he or she seeks. What am I?
You're both in and outside of me; You guide me but don't ride me; I can make a statement with a tongue but no mouth. What am I?
I am big on Saturday and Sunday. Small on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday. I'm not on Monday or Friday. What am I?
Squeeze me and I cry tears as red as flesh, but my heart is made of stone. What am I?
No legs have I to dance,No lungs have I to breathe,No life have I to live or dieAnd yet I do all three.What am I?
A hole leading in, a hole leading out, we connect to a cavern that is slimy all throughout. What are we?

I look flat, but I am deep, Hidden realms I shelter. Lives I take, but food I offer. At times I am beautiful. I can be calm, angry and turbulent. I have no heart, but offer pleasure as well as death. No man can own me, yet I encompass what all men must have. What am I?
My voice is tender, my waist is slender and I'm often invited to play. Yet wherever I go I must take my bow or else I have nothing to say. What am I?
I have four wings, but cannot fly, I never laugh and never cry; On the same spot I'm always found, toiling away with little sound. What am I?

I have no voice and yet I speak to you, I tell of all things in the world that people do. I have leaves, but I am not a tree, I have pages, but I am not a bride or royalty. I have a spine and hinges, but I am not a man or a door, I have told you all, I cannot tell you more. What am I?

I'm like a doll, But I'm not for playing; I stand up straight, but if windy I may be laying; I'm well-known and famous for having no brain; I work outside both day and night in sunshine or in rain. What am I?
They fill me up and you empty me, almost everyday; if you raise my arm, I work the opposite way. What am I?
I run through hills; I veer around mountains. I leap over rivers and crawl through the forests. Step out your door to find me. What am I?

Some will use me, while others will not, some have remembered, while others have forgotten. For-profit or gain, I'm used expertly, I can't be picked off the ground or tossed into the sea. Only gained from patience and time, can you unravel my rhyme? What am I?
I'm so fast you can't see me, though everyone else can see straight through me. I don't stop until the day you die. What am I?
Tool of thief, toy of queen. Always used to be unseen. Sign of joy, sign of sorrow. Giving all likeness borrowed. What am I?
I'm not clothes but I cover your body; The more I'm used, the thinner I grow. What am I?
I am born in fear, raised in truth,and I come to my own in deed.When comes a time that I'm called forth,I come to serve the cause of need.What am i?
My thunder comes before my lightning.My lightning comes before my rain.And my rain dries all the ground it touches.What am I?
It comes only before,It comes only after,Rises only in darkness,But rises only in light.It is always the same,But is yet always different.What am I?
Within, I clean all that is bad and is old.I make juice that's the color of gold.Should I die, a filter machine would you need assembledto replace me โฆ and beans I resemble.What am I?
I cut through evillike a double edged sword,And chaos flees at my approach.Balance I single-handedly upraise,Through battles fought with heart and mind,Instead of with my gaze.What am I?

Creatures of power, creatures of grace,Creatures of beauty, creatures of strength.As for their lives, they set everything's pace,For all things must come to live under their emerald embrace. . .Either in their life, or in their death.What am I?
If you break me, I'll not stop working.If you can touch me, my work is done.If you lose me, you must find me with a ring soon after.What am I?
First you see me in the grass dressed in yellow gay;next I am in dainty white, then I fly away. What am I?
I weaken all men for hours each day.I show you strange visions while you are away.I take you by night, by day take you back,None suffer to have me, but do from my lack.What am I?
Iron roof, glass wallsBurns and burnsAnd never falls.What am I?
Take me and scratch my head.What once was red,Is black instead.What am I?
Armless, legless, I crawl around when I'm young.Then the time of changing sleep will come.I will awake like a newborn, flying beast,'till then on the remains of the dead I feast.Who am I?
From house to house I go,sometimes narrow,sometimes wide.And whether there's rain or snow,I always stay outside.What am I?
At night they come without being fetched,And by day they are lost without being stolen.Whar are they?
My head bobs lazily in the sun.You think I'm cute,For my face is yellow,My hair is white,and my body is green.What am I?

A horrid monster hides from the day,With many legs and many eyes.With silver chains it catches prey,And eats it all before it dies.Yet in every cottage does it stay,And every castle 'neath the sky.What is it?
Large as a mountain, small as a pea,Endlessly swimming in a waterless sea.What am I?
People are hired to get rid of me.I'm often hiding under your bed.In time I'll always return you see.Bite me and you're surely dead.What am I?

My first is in wield, sever bones and marrow.My second is in blade, forged in cold steel.My third is in arbalest, and also in arrows.My fourth is in power, plunged through a shield.My fifth is in honour, and also in vowsMy last will put an end to it all.What am I?
You can see nothing elseWhen you look in my face,I will look you in the eyeAnd I will never lie.What am I?
I do not breathe, but I run and jump.I do not eat, but I swim and stretch.I do not drink, but I sleep and stand.I do not think, but I grow and play.I do not see, but you see me every day.What am I?
I make you weak at the worst of all times.I keep you safe, I keep you fine.I make your hands sweat, and your heart grow cold,I visit the weak, but seldom the bold.What am I?
Walk on the living, they don't even mumble. Walk on the dead, they mutter and grumble.What are we?
As beautiful as the setting sun,As delicate as the morning dew;An angel's dusting from the starsthat can turn the Earth intoA frosted moon.What am I?
Lovely and round,I shine with pale light,grown in the darkness,A lady's delight.What am I?

Inside me the adventurous findQuests and treasures of every kind.Trolls, goblins, orcs, and more, awaitWithin my closed walls forAll those that wish to visit me.Your hands are the keyTo secrets untold,And your mind will unlock the door.What am I?
Hands she has but does not hold,teeth she has but does not bite,feet she has but they are cold,eyes she has but without sight.Who is she?
A thousand colored folds stretch toward the sky,Atop a tender strand,Rising from the land,'Til killed by maiden's hand,Perhaps a token of love, perhaps to say goodbye.What am I?
Three lives have I.Gentle enough to soothe the skin,Light enough to caress the sky,Hard enough to crack rocks.

Of no use to oneYet absolute bliss to two.The small boy gets it for nothing.The young man has to lie for it.The old man has to buy it.The baby's right,The lover's privilege,The hypocrite's mask.To the young girl, faith;To the married woman, hope;To the old maid, charity.What am I?
Weight in my belly,Trees on my back,Nails in my ribs,Feet I do lack.What am I?

We are very little creatures; all of us have different features. One of us in glass is set; one of us you'll find in jet. Another you may see in tin, and a fourth is boxed within. If the fifth you should pursue, it can never fly from you.What are we?
If a man carried my burdenHe would break his back.I am not rich,But leave silver in my track.Who am I?
I am seen in the waterIf seen in the sky,I am in the rainbow,A jay's feather,And lapis lazuli.What am I?
I go around in circles,But always straight aheadNever complain,No matter where I am led.What am I?
The cost of making only the maker knows,Valueless if bought, but sometimes traded.A poor man may give one as easily as a king.When one is broken pain and deceit are assured.What am I?
I drive men madFor love of me,Easily beaten,Never free.What am I?
When young, I am sweet in the sun.When middle-aged, I make you giddy.When old, I am valued more than ever.What am I?
I do not live, but I grow; I have no lungs, but I need air; I have no mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
I'm not pants but I have pockets;I can't dance but I have four legs.I come in different sizes depending on the size of the room.What am I?
I swing around on sticks, and use them to do my tricks, a white powder helps me to grip, and people cheer when I flip. What am I?
I am a ball that can be rolled but never bounced or thrown.What am I?
I am present in marshesAnd also in the rumen of cattleTo stop global warmingI do very little.What am I?

When liquid splashes me, none seeps through.When I am moved a lot, liquid I spew.When I am hit, color I change.And color, I come in quite a range.What I cover is very complex, and I am very easy to flex.What am I?
I'm unique in one way but you can find two of me in your daily drink. What am I?
I may not be gold but I make gold look more beautiful. I help you fly and even though I'm not popular, my prices run high. What am I?
Anyone can hold me, even without their hands, yet no one can do it for long.What am I?
When combined, these four periodic elements make up something that terrifies criminals?
answers: Carbon, Oxygen, Phosphorous & Sulfur (C + O + P + S)

questions: I can be hot, I can be cold,I can run and I can be still,I can be hard and I can be soft.What am I?
What is neither water nor land, and is always soaking wet?
When the son of the water returns to the parent, it dies. What is it?
I touch your face. I am in your words. I am a lack of space and beloved by birds. What am I?
I can be good for you, but I can also be bad for you. You can find me all over your body. What am I?
I like to roam but always stay home. If you carried what I carried you'd break your back. What am I?
What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and gray when you throw it away?
I can eat a lot of iron without getting sick. What am I?
You can't see me, but I can see you. To be more specific, I see through. What am I?
In addition to the sunThis is what enables plants to growIt is a four-letter wordAnd it comes before forest and bowWhat is it?
I am a tunnel, a shortcut that connects places across space and time. What am I?
It is impossible for me to be created, and I can never be destroyed, I can only change form. What am I?
I am three-quarters of the universe and almost nothing is known about me. What am I?
You will find me in Mercury, Earth, Mars, and Jupiter, but not on Venus or Neptune. What am I?
I am a rock that's bigger than Venus but smaller than Uranus. What am I?
Many have heard it, but nobody has ever seen it. It will not speak back unless spoken to. What is it?
This fruit is made of two words conjoinedThe first part of it is also a treeThe second part is a different fruitAnd goes on a pizza from HawaiiWhat is it?
I can be chewed but should not be swallowed or eaten and always get thrown away. What am I?
I am the meanest of all foods and it takes all the might of your teeth to tear me apart. What am I?
I am a container without hinges, a lock, or a key, yet a golden treasure lies inside me. What am I?
Hot or cold, running or still, hard or soft, I can be anything. What am I?
I am clean, but not water.I am white, but not snow.I am sweet, but not ice cream.What am I?
I am a beer yet kids can drink me and never get drunk. What am I?
I am a food that explodes. But long before I explode, I am already dead. I can be small, I can be big, and I can be fragrant. What am I?
I come once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years. What am I?
If you hit me hard, I might crack. But you'll never stop me from staring back. What am I?
I am always in you and sometimes on you. If I surround you, I can kill you. What am I?
I have lakes but no water. I have streets no cars. I have many places and borders, but I'm in one piece. What am I?
I belong in the month of December, but not in any other month. I am not a holiday either. What am I?
No matter how little or how much you use me every day, you change me every month. What am I?
I protect, I stand tall. The reason for my existence is to strike fear in all. What am I?
You can hear me and control me, but never see me or touch me. What am I?
You can catch me easily, especially around Christmas, but you can never throw me. What am I?
Those who make me are likely to break me, what am I?
I have six faces but do not wear makeup, and twenty-one eyes, but cannot see. What am I?
I am tall when I'm young and short when I'm old. I can brighten your day, unless it's windy. What am I?
I love sugars and treats, I am a little critter and I sound a lot like your Mom and Dad's sister. What am I?
I have a home and a big space, I have keys but I have no locks, I have lots of letters but I have no mailbox. What am I?

I flop around on sticks and sometimes you cheer me as I do, I desperately need a white powder to do what needs to be done, and looking at me you might wonder why I look like I am about to go swimming. What am I?
What has six faces, but does not wear makeup, has twenty-one eyes, but cannot see?
What looks like Chimpanzee but is not a Chimpanzee?
I am first on earth, the second in heaven.I appear twice a week, though you only see me once in a year.What am I?

A favorite by Teddy Roosevelt:"I talk, but I do not speak my mindI hear words, but I do not listen to thoughtsWhen I wake, all see meWhen I sleep, all hear meMany heads are on my shouldersMany hands are at my feetThe strongest steel cannot break my visageBut the softest whisper can destroy meThe quietest whimper can be heard."

This riddle is from the 5th Harry Potter movie and book, so if you've read or seen them, please skip to the next riddle!"First think of the personwho lives in disguise,who deal in secrets and tells naught but lies.Next, tell me what's alwaysthe last thing to mend,the middle of middle andend of end? And finally,give me the sound often heardDuring the search for a hard-to-find word.Now string them together, and answer me this,Which creature would you be unwilling to kiss?"

This was Gollum's final riddle from The Hobbit:"This thing all things devours;Bird, beasts, trees, flowers;Gnaws iron, bites steel;Grinds hard stones to meal;Slay king, ruins town,and beats a mountain down."
What moves across the land but never has to steer?It has delivered our goods year after year.What is it?
We are four brothers who always stand the same distance from each other. We run and we run but never reach each other. What are we?
I never was, am always to be,No one ever saw me, nor ever will,And yet I am the confidence of all,To live and breathe on this terrestrial ball.What am I?

It can't be seen, can't be felt, can't be heard and can't be smelt. It lies behind stars and under hills, and empty holes it fills. It comes first and follows after, ends life and kills laughter. What is it?
I am white and I am black. I am not fat because I need to be fast.  I confuse many people with my style. What am I?
Lifeless eyes on my smiling face and watch your child's sleeping place. In their dreams they hold me tight. What am I?
Though I wander the earth, I am no longer here.I am pale and I chill everyone near.What am I?
My neighbor makes mistakes. I get rid of them. what am I?
If you happen to wear one of these warm garments around, you might get doused in red paint.
I'm the son of water but when I return to water I die. What am I?
I do not speak, but there is no word I cannot make. What am I?

I am a fruit. If you had two of me, I would sound just the same. If you rearrange my letters, it could be a crime. Add me to a montage and I can become a different fruit. Remove my head and you can still listen; take away the end and I can still be eaten. Without a piece of the center, I am still a word; take away allof the middle and I am just an acronym. What am I?
I cause your vehicle to move without wanting to. What am I?
I am good at concealing what's real and hide what's true.Sometimes, I bring out the courage in you!What am I?
I always have to work with something in my eye. What am I?
What is something you can hold without ever touching?
Turn me on my side and I am everything. Cut me in half and I am nothing. What am I?
The more you take away from me, the bigger I get.What am I?
I have no life, but I can feed others before I die.
What's black and white and read all over?
What has a bottom at the top?
I pass before the sun and move things about, yet make no shadow. What am I?
With pointed fangs I sit and wait; with piercing force I crunch out fate; grabbing victims, proclaiming might; physically joining with a single bite. What am I?
I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but whatever I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
People make me, save me, change me, raise me. What am I?
I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
It stalks the countryside with ears that can't hear. What is it?
What has 13 hearts, but no other organs?
What is cut on a table, but is never eaten?
What can you break without ever touching it?
I start with T, end with T, and have T in me. What am I?
I am a 7 letter word. I become longer when my third letter is removed. What am I?
I am a part of your body. You can hold me in your left hand but not in your right hand. What am I?
You've heard me before, yet you hear me again, then I die until you call me again.What am I?
What 10 letter word starts with gas?
What connects two people but touches only one?
They are dark and on the run, and without sun there will be none.What are they?
If I have it, I don't share it. If I share it, I don't have it.What is it?
What has 4 eyes but cannot see?

I can sizzle like bacon, I am made with an egg, I have plenty of backbone, but lack a good leg.I peel layers like onions, but still remain whole, I can be long like a flagpole, yet fit in a hole.What am I?
What looks bigger without a head than with one?
I see without seeing, and noise is an ally.What am I?
I'm attractive, shaped like a shoe, bi-polar and may just repel you.What am I?
I'm tall when I'm young and short when I'm old.What am I?
I am the shortest complete sentence in the English language.
What's black when you get it, red when you use it and white when you're done with it?
My life can be measured in hours. I serve by being devoured. Thin, I am quick. Fat, I am slow. Wind is my foe.What am I?

I drift forever with the current down these long canals they've made. Tame, yet wild, I run elusive, multitasking to your aid. Before I came the world was a darker place. Colder, sometimes, rougher true. But though I might make living easy, I'm good at killing too.What am I?
At the sound of me, men may dream or stamp their feet. At the sound of me, women may laugh or sometimes weep.What am I?
If you drop me I'm sure to crack, but give me a smile and I'll always smile back.What am I?
What can run but can't walk?
What has hands but can't clap?
You answer me but I ask you nothing. What am I?
Halo of water, tongue of wood, skin of stone, long I've stood.What am I?
I see you, you see me; I raise my right hand,  you raise your left. What Am I?
When you have more of me, you see a lot less.What am I?
I go through cities, towns and villages, but I never come inside.What am I?
Everyone needs it. Everyone gives it. But few ever take it. What is it?
I can only live where there is light, but I die if the light shines on me. What am I?
I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. You can enter but can't go outside. What am I?
I am a mother and a father, but have never given birth. I'm rarely still, but I never wander. What am I?
I am always there, some distance away, somewhere between land or sea and sky I fly, you may move towards me, yet distant I shall stay.
What flies when it's born, lies when it's alive, and runs when it's dead?
Give me food, and I will live. Give me water, and I will die. What am I?
We hurt without moving. We poison without touching. We bear the truth and the lies. We are not to be judged by our size.
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What do you break before you use it?
What gets whiter the dirtier it gets?
I have 4 legs but I can't walk. What am I?
I always follow my brother, though very different we are. You can see him but not me, you can hear me, but not him.
People need me, but they always give me away. What am I?
I hover without wings. I cry without eyes.
You'll always find me in the past. I can be created in the present, but the future can never taint me. What am I?
What brings you down but never up?
What is heavy one way but not the other?
What stays where it is when it goes off?
When they're alive we sing, when they're dead we clap! What are they?
What has cities but no house.Forests, but not trees.Water, but no fish?
The shorter I am, the bigger I am.What am I?
You may enter, but you may not come in. I have space, but no room. I have keys, but open no lock. What am I?
What has a foot, but no leg?
If you cut me, I won't cry - but YOU will.What am I?
What can you catch, but not throw?
What loses a head in the morning and gains it again at night?
What tastes better than it smells?
Everyone asks for me, but everyone hates to face me. For some I am agony. For others, I am relief.What Am I?
It only increases and never decreases. What is it?
What flies when it's born, lies when it's alive and runs when it's dead?
I'm not alive but I have five fingers. What Am I?
Someone makes it, but has no need of it.Someone buys it, but has no use for it.Someone uses it, but can neither see nor feel it.What is it?
I'm light as a feather, yet the strongest man can't hold me for more than a few minutes.What Am I?
It lives without a body, hears without ears, speaks without a mouth, to which the air alone gives birth. What is it?
You can't keep me until you have given me.What Am I?
I beam, shine and sparkle white,I brighten the day with a single light.I charm and enchant one and all,I can counter the darkest pall.What Am I?
I occur twice in eternity, and I'm always within sight.What Am I?
I turn around once, what is out will not get in.I turn around again,what is in will not get out.What Am I?
Soldiers line up, spaced with pride, two long rows lined side by side.One sole unit can decide,if the rows will unite or divide.What is it?
The sun bakes them. The hand breaks them. The foot treads them. The mouth tastes them. What are they?
I can be measured, but never seen. What am I?
What breaks on water but never on land?
I'm a rare case where today comes before yesterday. What am I?
I can shave every day, but my beard will stay the same. What am I?
I'm greater than God, more evil than the devil, the poor have me, the rich need me, and if you eat me, you'll die.What Am I?
I can travel around the world while staying in a corner.What Am I?
